conversations.content: Whew! The fiends we had to deal with today were a pretty tough bunch.
Sure, but we got a whole bunch'a rupies in return! That ain't such a bad deal.
...Your Highness?
Prince Euden?!
Hmm? ...Wait, I know you! You're Thaniel! From the navy!
Thank goodness you're all right... Now I can finally...
Thaniel? ...Thaniel!
...Huh? Wh-where am I?
It's good to see you again.
You're at our base, or what is our base for the time being: the Windwyrm's castle.
It is a joy to see you again, Your Highness.
I am humbled that you remember the name of a mere private like myself.
Of course I remember you, Thaniel. You sailed for us many times.
So tell me, what's a sailor like you doing so far from the sea?
Errr... Well...it's because... Umm...
I have abandoned the navy.
Wait, you quit? Why?
I decided that if I was going to swear fealty to a cause, I'd prefer that cause be Your Highness's.
I've long admired you, and after learning that you'd set out on a journey, I left the navy in hopes I could work for your cause.
Well, this is quite the surprise. Thank you, Thaniel.
Of course, you're welcome to stay here as long as you like.
I'll go and let the others know you're here.
For now, just rest.
Bah... I can't believe I did that!
I lied to him, confident in the knowledge that his kindness will prevent him from doubting me. Oh, I am so ashamed!
I didn't come after him because I was loyal to him—I came after him because of what I had done.
Yet he's being so welcoming and kind...
Damnation! I cannot permit myself to take advantage of that kindness! I must find him and tell him the truth!
I must tell him the real reason that I abandoned the navy!
Oh, right. About your room—
Y-yes?! What is it?!
Are you all right? You seem...flustered.
M-me? Heavens, no! Perish the thought! Now then, what did you want to say about my room?
Oh, I was just going to say that we have a number of free rooms, so you're welcome to take your pick.
(Blast! I did it again! N-next time...)
(Next time, I'll tell him the truth!)
We have a serious problem: I don't have  enough ingredients for tonight's dinner.
Might I ask you to go stock up for us, Euden?
Er, you want me to carry back enough to feed an entire castle on my own?
Everyone else is busy, I'm afraid.
Although if you feel it acceptable for all of us to go without dinner tonight, you're welcome to refuse.
All right, all right. I'll go.
Your Highness? Are you going out?
Yes. Apparently I need to go buy food for  literally everyone.
What?! You have been sent to do shopping like a common peasant?! ALONE?!
Ah! I have the perfect solution!
I've just been out fishing in the lake, you see, and my day was most profitable.
Feast your eyes on THIS catch!
Oh wow, look at all that fish... This is enough to feed everyone and have leftovers tomorrow!
You must be a real natural at fishing.
Did you often fish when you were at sea?
Heavens, no. I cannot stand the sea.  I wouldn't dream of fishing there.
I much prefer a leisurely spot of fishing by the side of a lake.
Huh? Really? It seems strange that someone in the navy hates the sea.
Blast!
...Well, I suppose the cat is out of the proverbial sack now.
To tell you the truth, I didn't join the navy of my own free will—a fact that caused me to loathe my time there.
My father, a navy man, forced me to join, and I spent my days being put through the mill by older sailors. It was...hell.
Well, I'm not surprised you hated it. No one enjoys being forced to do something against their will.
Er, aren't you angry with me? I lied to you!
Of course I'm not angry. I've no right to know every single detail of your life. There's no harm in personal secrets.
(Guh... He really is kind...)
(Yet here I am lying about swearing loyalty to him. Have I no shame...?)
Y-Your Highness! Actually, I... Umm...
Yes? What is it?
I know I said that I hated being in the  navy, but...
But my loyalty to you is genuine! There is NO need to worry on that score!
Oh, that's what you were going to say? Well, thanks, Thaniel.
It's a bit embarrassing to have something like that said to your face, but I'm still happy to hear it.
Urk...
Anyway, we should get back to the castle.
Everyone must be starving.
Damnation... I did it again...
I got cold feet at the last moment because I was afraid of betraying his kindness...
N-next time, I will definitely tell him the truth! Make no mistake!
Even if he ends up hating me, I can keep  this charade up no longer!
Hyaaaah!
It's almost time for dinner, Your Highness. I think you ought to put your training on hold for the time being.
Sorry, but can you wait just a little longer?
I'm almost done with this set of reps.
I just need a little more time!
You are more dedicated and focused than ever in these dark days...
And yet, behold me. I am a mere... *sniff*
What is it, Thaniel?
I am so very sorry, Your Highness, but I can dissemble no longer.
I must tell you the real reason why I came to this castle.
And once done...I will leave here forever.
Ooo...kay?
When I was reunited with you, I told you that I left the navy because I wished to swear my loyalty to you.
That, I fear, was a lie.
I had been searching for a way out of the navy for a very long time.
When the capital was thrown into chaos, I seized my chance and turned tail, leaving the navy behind.
So that's what happened...
For a moment, I felt like I was finally free.
But then, I remembered the words Father had spoken to me so many times...
＂Protect the king from the tallest of waves and the fiercest of gales.＂
After hearing that so many times, I felt I had no choice but to honor his wishes and protect the king.
And though deeply ashamed at my cowardice, I thought that helping you might alleviate that somewhat.
...And there you have it.
I've been lying to you from the moment we reunited. All my talk of loyalty was just—
Enough, Thaniel. It doesn't matter.
It... What?
No matter your reasons for doing so, you still came to find me.
That's enough to make me happy.
Ah!
So now that you have that off your chest, will you return to the castle?
O-of course, Your Highness! I would...  I'd be honored to... Waaaah!
Whoa, easy! It's nothing to cry about!
Haaaaah!
All right, that's the last of them. The town should be safe now.
You fought well, Your Highness.
I owe it all to your support, Thaniel.
Do you always take part in fierce battles such as these from the front line, sire?
Given your position as royalty, I feel it would be better for you to leave it to myself and the others while you hold back.
Logically, you're probably right.
But I feel a leader should serve as a shield for their people.
I refuse to allow my companions—my friends—to fight my battles for me.
How you resemble your father right now...
King Aurelius often said the same.
He did—and if I want to surpass him, I need all of you fighting by my side.
I don't have a chance of succeeding alone.
Everyone's support will make the difference between success and failure.
Do you see now why I don't want to just stand at the back and issue orders?
I need comrades-in-arms, companions, and friends of equal standing.
If I can't laugh and smile and cry with those I lead—off AND on the battlefield— then they will never respect me.
And that includes you, Thaniel.
You really are dedicated to surpassing your father, Your Highness.
...Very well. My mind is decided!
Hmm? How so?
Do you remember how my father said to ＂protect the king from the tallest of waves and the fiercest of gales＂?
Those were the words he used to drill into your head, yes?
That's right. And all this time, I've felt that I had a duty to honor them—both in letter and in spirit.
I never chose to protect the royal family— it was simply something I had to do; as natural as taking a breath.
Because of both how I was raised and my time in the military.
But after hearing you speak about your father—and watching you in battle—I have changed my mind!
No longer do I desire to ＂protect＂ you as my father claimed I should.
Now I wish to fight by your side so that we may BOTH overcome our fathers!
It's reassuring to hear you say that.
Just know that I'll be counting on you!
No matter how rough the waves ahead are, we will conquer them together!
Ugh. Looks like I've gotten separated from the others...
There's no way I can take on this many by myself...
Graaaaaaah!
Uh-oh... Is this it for me?
A-are you all right, Your Highness?!
Thaniel! Am I ever glad to see you! But what are you doing here?
There's nowhere I wouldn't go to save you from danger, sire!
Grrrrrr...
Graaaaaaah!
Urk! There's more of them?!
Are you okay, Thaniel? You don't need to act brave for my benefit.
I am well, Your Highness. This is nothing!
...N-no. You're right.
I almost lied to you again just to try to appear strong.
I'm actually TERRIFIED! I've never fought this many monsters at once in my life!
All I want to do right now is run away screaming and never look back!
Really? What a coincidence! I'm also scared out of my wits!
...But at least I'm not alone.
With you by my side, I know we can get through this.
Y-Your Highness!
Damn it... I'm so pitiful!
How could I be thinking of running away when that's how you're feeling?!
But now your words have opened my eyes. I will fight by your side ever more, sire!
Even if it comes at the cost of my life, I will see you to—
Not a chance!
What?!
Wh-what do you mean, Highness?
I mean exactly what I said: I don't want you to risk your life for me.
I told you that we're equals, which means we're going to run away and live to fight another day TOGETHER.
Then we'll head back to the castle for some very well deserved sleep!
Although we'll have to listen to Cleo grumble about how dangerous all of this was first...
But at least we'll get grumbled at together!
Besides, Cleo always makes the best food once she's done grumbling, so we can enjoy some of that.
Th-thank you, Your Highness...
After all the times I lied to you, to still call me an equal...
Are you ready, Thaniel?
Just give the word!
Let's do this, Your Highness!
